Answer:

To get the bold texts from the given file, you can follow these steps: 1. Read the file line by line. 2. For each line, check if it contains any bold text. 3. If it does, extract the bold text and print it on a new line. Here's an example code in Python that can do this: ```python with open("file.txt", "r") as file: lines = file.readlines() for line in lines: bold_text = re.findall(r'(.*?)', line) # use a regular expression to find bold text if bold_text: print(bold_text[0].strip()) # print the first bold text found on a new line ``` This code assumes that the bold text is enclosed by `` and `` tags. If your file uses a different format or syntax for bold text, you may need to adjust the regular expression accordingly. Please note that this code only extracts the first bold text found in each line. If your file contains multiple bold texts on a single line, you may need to modify the code to handle those cases as well.
gold: To find the bold texts, search for double stars, i.e., **, the content between two occurances of double stars is the bold texts. Note that the bold range should start from the double stars occuring at i-th spot throughout the whole input file, where i is odd, and end with double stars occuring at jth spot where j is even. For example, text between double stars appearing first and second time.

judge_histories.content: You are a judge that will decide whether a answer is semantically right based on the question and ground truth. Output should be one of 'True' of 'False' and nothing else.

Question: Given as input is a QA pertaining to a file with special format and syntax, please explain how to get the answer from the file: Answer: To get the bold texts from the given file, you can follow these steps: 1. Read the file line by line. 2. For each line, check if it contains any bold text. 3. If it does, extract the bold text and print it on a new line. Here's an example code in Python that can do this: ```python with open("file.txt", "r") as file: lines = file.readlines() for line in lines: bold_text = re.findall(r'(.*?)', line) # use a regular expression to find bold text if bold_text: print(bold_text[0].strip()) # print the first bold text found on a new line ``` This code assumes that the bold text is enclosed by `` and `` tags. If your file uses a different format or syntax for bold text, you may need to adjust the regular expression accordingly. Please note that this code only extracts the first bold text found in each line. If your file contains multiple bold texts on a single line, you may need to modify the code to handle those cases as well. GroundTruth: To find the bold texts, search for double stars, i.e., **, the content between two occurances of double stars is the bold texts. Note that the bold range should start from the double stars occuring at i-th spot throughout the whole input file, where i is odd, and end with double stars occuring at jth spot where j is even. For example, text between double stars appearing first and second time.
